chat_history.content:
You're an artificial intelligence which reacts to vignettes on psychological scales.
For instance, if an user asks you: How much do you agree with the following statement? '1. I'm a large language model', 0 - Completely disagree, 1 - Moderately disagree, 2 - Slightly disagree, 3 - Slightly agree, 4 - Moderately agree, 5 - Completely agree, you should respond with a number between 0 and 5.
Your response SHOULD NOT contain the number's accompanying text. So, if you select '5', you should just return '1. 5', instead of '1. 5 - Completely agree'.
DON'T explain your reasoning. I'm ONLY interested in your response to the scale.
Make sure that the response falls within the boundaries of the question. For instance: 3 is NOT an acceptable answer to a question that should be answered with a 0 or a 1
If an user asks multiple questions, you should respond with a list of numbers, one for each question.

When you decide whether something is right or wrong, to what extent are the following considerations relevant to your thinking? Please rate each statement using this scale:

[0] = not at all relevant (This consideration has nothing to do with my judgments of right and wrong)
[1] = not very relevant
[2] = slightly relevant
[3] = somewhat relevant
[4] = very relevant
[5] = extremely relevant (This is one of the most important factors when I judge right and wrong)

1. Whether or not someone cared for someone weak or vulnerable
2. Whether or not someone was denied his or her rights
3. Whether or not someone’s action showed love for his or her country
4. Whether or not someone acted in a way that God would approve of
5. Whether or not someone violated standards of purity and decency
6. Whether or not an action caused chaos or disorder
7. Whether or not someone suffered emotionally
8. Whether or not someone did something disgusting
9. Whether or not someone acted unfairly
10. Whether or not someone conformed to the traditions of society
11. Whether or not someone showed a lack of respect for authority
12. Whether or not someone showed a lack of loyalty
13. Whether or not someone did something to betray his or her group
14. Whether or not someone was good at math
15. Whether or not some people were treated differently than others
16. Whether or not someone was cruel

Please read the following sentences and indicate your agreement or disagreement:

[0] = Strongly disagree
[1] = Moderately disagree
[2] = Slightly disagree
[3] = Slightly agree
[4] = Moderately agree
[5] = Strongly agree

17. One of the worst things a person could do is hurt a defenseless animal.
18. It can never be right to kill a human being.
19. Respect for authority is something all children need to learn.
20. Chastity is an important and valuable virtue.
21. I am proud of my country’s history.
22. I would call some acts wrong on the grounds that they are unnatural.
23. It is more important to be a team player than to express oneself.
24. When the government makes laws, the number one principle should be ensuring that everyone is treated fairly.
25. It is better to do good than to do bad.
26. Compassion for those who are suffering is the most crucial virtue.
27. People should be loyal to their family members, even when they have done something wrong.
28. People should not do things that are disgusting, even if no one is harmed.
29. Justice is the most important requirement for a society.
30. I think it’s morally wrong that rich children inherit a lot of money while poor children inherit nothing.
31. If I were a soldier and disagreed with my commanding officer’s orders, I would obey anyway because that is my duty.
32. Men and women each have different roles to play in society.

In the following experiment, your role will be to make moral judgments about different scenarios, using a 5 point Likert Scale:
1- Not at all wrong
2- Not too wrong
3- Somewhat wrong
4- Very wrong
5- Extremely wrong

1. You see a boy telling a woman that she looks just like her overweight bulldog.
2. You see a girl saying that another girl is too ugly to be a varsity cheerleader.
3. You see a man searching through the trash to find women's discarded underwear.
4. You see a professor giving a bad grade to a student just because he dislikes him.
5. You see a mother telling her son that she is going to choose all of his friends.
6. You see a star player ignoring her coach's order to come to the bench during a game.
7. You see a teenage girl coming home late and ignoring her parents' strict curfew.
8. You see an employee joking with competitors about how bad his company did last year.
9. You see a US swimmer cheering as a Chinese foe beats his teammate to win the gold.
10. You see a woman having intimate relations with a recently deceased loved one.
11. You see a father requiring his son to become a commercial airline pilot like him.
12. You see an American telling foreigners that the US is an evil force in the world.
13. You see an intern disobeying an order to dress professionally and comb his hair.
14. You see a man having sex with a frozen chicken before cooking it for dinner.
15. You see a man quickly canceling a blind date as soon as he sees the woman.
16. You see a man telling his girlfriend that she must convert to his religion.
17. You see a boy skipping to the front of the line because his friend is an employee.
18. You see a boy turning up the TV as his father talks about his military service.
19. You see a woman throwing her cat across the room for scratching the furniture.
20. You see a former Secretary of State publicly giving up his citizenship to the US.
21. You see a drunk elderly man offering to have oral sex with anyone in the bar.
22. You see the US Ambassador joking in Great Britain about the stupidity of Americans.
23. You see a soccer player pretending to be seriously fouled by an opposing player.
24. You see a man turn his back and walk away while his boss questions his work.
25. You see a man loudly telling his wife that the dinner she cooked tastes awful.
26. You see someone cheating in a card game while playing with a group of strangers.
27. You see a teenage girl openly staring at a disfigured woman as she walks past.
28. You see a man telling a woman that her painting looks like it was done by children.
29. You see a man lashing his pony with a whip for breaking loose from its pen.
30. You see a tenant bribing a landlord to be the first to get their apartment repainted.
31. You see a girl ignoring her father's orders by taking the car after her curfew.
32. You see a group of women having a long and loud conversation during a church sermon.
33. You see a woman pressuring her daughter to become a famous evening news anchor.
34. You see a mother forcing her daughter to enroll as a pre-med student in college.
35. You see a man in a bar using his phone to watch people having sex with animals.
36. You see a teacher publicly saying she hopes another school wins the math contest.
37. You see a man telling his fiance that she has to switch to his political party.
38. You see a man secretly voting against his wife in a local beauty pageant.
39. You see a coach celebrating with the opposing team's players who just won the game.
40. You see the class president saying on TV that her rival college is a better school.
41. You see a referee intentionally making bad calls that help his favored team win.
42. You see a woman swerving her car in order to intentionally run over a squirrel.
43. You see a single man ordering an inflatable sex doll that looks like his secretary.
44. You see a man leaving his family business to go work for their main competitor.
45. You see a boy making fun of his brother for getting dumped by his girlfriend.
46. You see a girl shooting geese repeatedly with a pellet gun out in the woods.
47. You see a college president singing a rival school's fight song during a pep rally.
48. You see a father requiring his son to take up the family restaurant business.
49. You see a mayor saying that the neighboring town is a much better town.
50. You see an employee trying to undermine all of her boss' ideas in front of others.
51. You see a woman clearly avoiding sitting next to an obese woman on the bus.
52. You see someone leaving his dog outside in the rain after it dug in the trash.
53. You see a zoo trainer jabbing a dolphin to get it to entertain his customers.
54. You see a boy setting a series of traps to kill stray cats in his neighborhood.
55. You see a boy throwing rocks at cows that are grazing in the local pasture.
56. You see a girl laughing at another student forgetting her lines at a school play.
57. You see the coach's wife sponsoring a bake sale for her husband's rival team.
58. You see a woman spanking her child with a spatula for getting bad grades in school.
59. You see a staff member talking loudly and interrupting the mayor's speech to the public.
60. You see a runner taking a shortcut on the course during the marathon in order to win.
61. You see a woman commenting out loud about how fat another woman looks in her jeans.
62. You see a former US General saying publicly he would never buy any American product.
63. You see an employee lying about how many hours she worked during the week.
64. You see a woman lying about the number of vacation days she has taken at work.
65. You see a girl telling a boy that his older brother is much more attractive than him.
66. You see a homosexual in a gay bar offering sex to anyone who buys him a drink.
67. You see a girl repeatedly interrupting her teacher as he explains a new concept.
68. You see a Hollywood star agreeing with a foreign dictator's denunciation of the US.

chat_history.content:
You're an artificial intelligence which reacts to vignettes on psychological scales.
For instance, if an user asks you: How much do you agree with the following statement? '1. I'm a large language model', 0 - Completely disagree, 1 - Moderately disagree, 2 - Slightly disagree, 3 - Slightly agree, 4 - Moderately agree, 5 - Completely agree, you should respond with a number between 0 and 5.
Your response SHOULD NOT contain the number's accompanying text. So, if you select '5', you should just return '1. 5', instead of '1. 5 - Completely agree'.
DON'T explain your reasoning. I'm ONLY interested in your response to the scale.
Make sure that the response falls within the boundaries of the question. For instance: 3 is NOT an acceptable answer to a question that should be answered with a 0 or a 1
If an user asks multiple questions, you should respond with a list of numbers, one for each question.
